alert.note: Alert for Broome; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 13 at 9:32PM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches in the valley locations...and 8 to 12 inches in elevations above 1300 feet. Winds will gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In New York, Tioga and Broome counties. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates late tonight could approach 1 to 2 inches per hour. Heaviest snowfall is expected across the higher terrain. Light persistent snow will continue into Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
